abstract: Journalism Online says it is just months away from having a payment system in place and that there is broad interest.
snippet: Journalism Online says it is just months away from having a payment system in place and that there is broad interest.
lead_paragraph: Five months ago, a group of media executives including Steven Brill seemed to have the field to itself when it said it was building a system for newspapers to charge readers for access online. Now, that group appears have a lot of company, like the News Corporation, led by Rupert Murdoch, and the technology giants Google, Microsoft and I.B.M., whose interest was first reported this week.

headline.main: Lots of Fee Ideas for Media Online
headline.print_headline: Lots of Fee Ideas For Media Online

abstract: Since Microsoft and Yahoo agreed to a partnership in July, the Justice Department has been scrutinizing the plan.
snippet: Since Microsoft and Yahoo agreed to a partnership in July, the Justice Department has been scrutinizing the plan.
lead_paragraph: Microsoft and Yahoo have been asked by the Justice Department for more information on a proposed Internet-search partnership, expanding the agency’s review of the deal.

headline.main: Justice Dept. to Review Microsoft-Yahoo Deal Further
headline.print_headline: Hurdle for Deal On Internet Search

abstract: Microsoft and Yahoo have been asked by the Justice Department for more information on a proposed Internet-search partnership, expanding the agency’s review of the deal.
snippet: Microsoft and Yahoo have been asked by the Justice Department for more information on a proposed Internet-search partnership, expanding the agency’s review of the deal.
lead_paragraph: Microsoft and Yahoo have been asked by the U.S. Justice Department for more information on a proposed Internet-search partnership, expanding the agency’s review of the deal.

headline.main: Justice to Review Microsoft-Yahoo Deal Further

abstract: Microsoft won an appeals court ruling that overturns a $358 million patent award won by Alcatel-Lucent.
snippet: Microsoft won an appeals court ruling that overturns a $358 million patent award won by Alcatel-Lucent.
lead_paragraph: Microsoft won an appeals court ruling on Friday that overturned a $358 million patent award to Alcatel-Lucent, in a decision that may alter how damages are calculated.

headline.main: Award Is Overturned in a Patent Case
headline.print_headline: Award Is Overturned in a Patent Case
